name: Kepler-382
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-382 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-382 is a star with 0.857 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.94 times its radius. It is located 3134.00 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-382 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-382 b

Kepler-382 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.26 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-382.

The mass of Kepler-382 b is 1.88 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-382 b is 1.32 that of Earth. At 1.88 Earth masses, Kepler-382 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-382 c

Kepler-382 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 12.16 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-382.

The mass of Kepler-382 c is 2.94 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-382 c is 1.59 that of Earth. At 2.94 Earth masses, Kepler-382 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-382, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
